user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UT_ExecuteVaHandler:
```c
void UT_ExecuteVaHandler(UT_EntryKey_t FuncKey, const char *FunctionName, UT_VaHandlerFunc_t DefaultHandler,
                         va_list VaList)
{
    /* Check if the test case registered a hook, and use the default if not */
    if (UT_GetStubEntry(FuncKey, UT_ENTRYTYPE_FINAL_HANDLER) == NULL && DefaultHandler != NULL)
    {
        UT_SetVaHandlerFunction(FuncKey, DefaultHandler, NULL);
    }

    UT_DefaultStubImplWithArgs(FunctionName, FuncKey, 0, VaList);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No suspicious fragments found. None of the function parameters are assigned to or otherwise modified in this function body: 
- FuncKey is only used as an argument to other functions (no assignment or mutation). 
- FunctionName is a const char * parameter (the const qualifier prevents modification of the pointed-to characters and the pointer itself is not assigned). 
- DefaultHandler is only read and forwarded; it is not assigned to or altered. 
- VaList is forwarded to UT_DefaultStubImplWithArgs but not assigned to or modified in this function.

Note on va_list: Although some implementations define va_list as an array type (which is adjusted to a pointer when used as a parameter), this function does not perform any assignment to VaList itself. Any potential modification of the va_list object by callees is outside the scope of this function and would need to be inspected in those callee implementations, not here. Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
